52.heading: Carnal Chaos.
52.title: Flesh Gordon [videorecording]
52.author: presented by Hen's Tooth Video and by Mammoth Films.
notes: First issued 1974 as a motion picture.
Cast: Jason Williams, Suzanne Fields, Joseph Hudgins, William Hunt, John Hoyt as Professor Gordon.

Summary: "In this popular outrageous spoof of sci-fi films, Earth is thrown onto carnal chaos by a mysterious sex ray emanating from outer space. Flesh Gordon, Dale Ardor and their new found friend Dr. Flexi Jerkoff, must travel to the planet Porno to save Earth from certain devastation by the mad Emperor Wang. Includes 10 minutes of previously unseen footage and original trailer.
"This program contains mature subject matter. It is intended for viewing by adult audiences, 18 years and older."

141.author: John Prentice
notes: Summary from front matter: "The first story is about Rip and his girl friend Honey Dorian. They go to a carnival and meet a mysterious character called Big Boy and learn that a carnival is not what it seems. Then in the next story Rip and his butler Desmond get involved with computer disc warfare. Finally, Rip is on the trail of Doris Little who has stolen money from her bosses."

155.title: "If Something Isn't Done About that Smog, I'll Starve!"
155.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: A carnivore chases Fred to the Bedrock city limits, but loses him there in the polluted air.

156.heading: Carnivores.
156.title: "Welcome to the Darwinian Genepool Preserve"
156.author: Wiley.
notes: Key words: safety rails, hand feeding, carnivores, evolution.

157.title: "Carnivores of Light and Darkness
157.author: by Alan Dean Foster ; art by Keith Parkinson

158.heading: "Carnivorous Ants"* (Bimboo, June 30, 1987) / Omar Rosa. p.
158.title: 147 in The National Cartoonists Society Album 1988 ed.
158.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: The only meat they'll eat is filet mignon.

159.heading: Carnivorous Plants.
159.title: "No, Not Poison Ivy"
159.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Fred thinks they should move the picnic away from the plants; they appear carnivorous.
